A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: When Batman v. Superman came out and people (including friends) trashed it\, I went into the movie with very low expectations and was more than pleasantly surprised. I really\, really\, really hoped the same thing would happen when I went to see this movie. Alas\, it did not.  Not only was this a bad Star Wars movie\, this was just a plain bad movie.  Even my wife (who is not a Star Wars fan in the least) agreed. \nI would be remiss not to say that the movie is quite visually stunning.  I can't argue that Rian Johnson knows how to compose a shot\, but the story writing\, comedic timing\, character development\, and universe building in this movie is about on-par with maybe the Green Lantern movie.  \nI actually place this in the category of movies I wish I wouldn't have spent the money on seeing.
